sprysound

Class SprySound

  • java.lang.Object
    • sprysound.SprySound

  • public class SprySound
extends java.lang.Object
    Serves as the central class of the SprySound system, providing factory methods that client code uses to create Audio instances. Additionally, the system must be initialized and shutdown through the SprySound interface.
    Author:
    Christian Holton

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • MIN_VOLUME

        public static final double MIN_VOLUME
        The minimum value for the master-gain/volume. This value will mute the volume.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_VOLUME

        public static final double MAX_VOLUME
        The maximum value for the master-gain/volume. This value will produce the loudest volume.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_VOLUME

        public static final double DEFAULT_VOLUME
        The default value of master-gain/volume used in absence of a user-supplied volume value.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_NUM_LOOPS

        public static final int DEFAULT_NUM_LOOPS
        The default number of loops that sounds will be played in absence of a user-supplied number.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • SprySound

        public SprySound()

    • Method Detail

      • createPreloadedAudio

        public static PreloadedAudio createPreloadedAudio(java.lang.String fileName)
        Creates a new PreloadedAudio instance from the specified file name. The file associated with the new PreloadedAudio instance will be loaded completely into memory prior to being played. See PreloadedAudio for more information.

        Note that the file's containing directory must be on the classpath.

        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the audio file to load.
        Returns:
        A new PreloadedAudio based on the specified file.

      • createStreamingAudio

        public static StreamingAudio createStreamingAudio(java.lang.String fileName)
        Creates a new StreamingAudio instance from the specified file name. The file associated with the new StreamingAudio instance will be streamed when played (i.e. read and played at the same time). See StreamingAudio for more information.

        Note that the file's containing directory must be on the classpath.

        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the audio file to load.
        Returns:
        A new StreamingAudio based on the specified file

      • init

        public static void init()
        Initialize the SprySound system.

      • shutdown

        public static void shutdown()
        Shutdown the SprySound system in an orderly manner, allowing any currently playing sounds to finish before the system exits. More specifically, if there exists any Playback instance whose state equals PlaybackState.PLAYING or PlaybackState.PAUSE at the time shutdown() is called, then the system will wait until the states of all of those Playback instances have changed to PlaybackState.STOP before exiting.

      • acquireAudioInputStream

        protected static javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream acquireAudioInputStream(java.net.URL fileURL)
        Acquire an AudioInputStream based on the audio file data from the file URL. If the audio file is in MP3 or Ogg format, a call to decodeToPCM will be made and the AudioInputStream will be based on the new audio data.
        Parameters:
        fileURL - The specified file's URL.
        Returns:
        The AudioInputStream based on the file's URL.
